news_header: Chinese hackers attempted to breach the phones of US President Trump and VP JD Vance, raising concerns about data theft and national security.
news_text: Chinese hackers have reportedly tried to access the phones of US President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance, but it remains unclear if they successfully obtained any data or monitored it in real time. The New York Times, which is investigating the matter, has not revealed its sources due to the sensitive nature of the national security case. There is uncertainty about whether the hackers accessed encrypted text messages. The data from Trump's campaign could provide valuable insights for Chinese intelligence, including communication patterns and contact information. Trump's campaign team recently discovered the breach, which also affected various individuals in the US and abroad through Verizon.
